intro: Odontites catalaunicus gundisalvii, commonly known as the Catalan toothed bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Pyrenees region of Spain. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rocky slopes and forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves with toothed margins, and its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
